speaker: CONRADE
text: What the goodyear, my lord, why are you

speaker: CONRADE
text: thus out of measure sad?

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: There is no measure in the occasion that

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: breeds. Therefore the sadness is without limit.

speaker: CONRADE
text: You should hear reason.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: And when I have heard it, what blessing

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: brings it?

speaker: CONRADE
text: If not a present remedy, at least a patient

speaker: CONRADE
text: sufferance.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: I wonder that thou, being, as thou sayst thou

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: art, born under Saturn, goest about to apply a moral

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: medicine to a mortifying mischief. I cannot hide

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: what I am. I must be sad when I have cause, and

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: smile at no man’s jests; eat when I have stomach,

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: and wait for no man’s leisure; sleep when I am

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: drowsy, and tend on no man’s business; laugh when

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: I am merry, and claw no man in his humor.

speaker: CONRADE
text: Yea, but you must not make the full show of

speaker: CONRADE
text: this till you may do it without controlment. You

speaker: CONRADE
text: have of late stood out against your brother, and he

speaker: CONRADE
text: hath ta’en you newly into his grace, where it is

speaker: CONRADE
text: impossible you should take true root but by the fair

speaker: CONRADE
text: weather that you make yourself. It is needful that

speaker: CONRADE
text: you frame the season for your own harvest.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: I had rather be a canker in a hedge than a

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: rose in his grace, and it better fits my blood to be

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: disdained of all than to fashion a carriage to rob

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: love from any. In this, though I cannot be said to be

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: a flattering honest man, it must not be denied but I

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: am a plain-dealing villain. I am trusted with a

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: muzzle and enfranchised with a clog; therefore I

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: have decreed not to sing in my cage. If I had my

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: mouth, I would bite; if I had my liberty, I would do

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: my liking. In the meantime, let me be that I am, and

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: seek not to alter me.

speaker: CONRADE
text: Can you make no use of your discontent?

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: I make all use of it, for I use it only. Who

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: comes here?

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: What news, Borachio?

speaker: BORACHIO
text: I came yonder from a great supper. The

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Prince your brother is royally entertained by

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Leonato, and I can give you intelligence of an

speaker: BORACHIO
text: intended marriage.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: Will it serve for any model to build mischief

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: on? What is he for a fool that betroths himself to

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: unquietness?

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Marry, it is your brother’s right hand.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: Who, the most exquisite Claudio?

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Even he.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: A proper squire. And who, and who? Which

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: way looks he?

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Marry, on Hero, the daughter and heir of

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Leonato.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: A very forward March chick! How came you

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: to this?

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Being entertained for a perfumer, as I was

speaker: BORACHIO
text: smoking a musty room, comes me the Prince and

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Claudio, hand in hand, in sad conference. I

speaker: BORACHIO
text: whipped me behind the arras, and there heard it

speaker: BORACHIO
text: agreed upon that the Prince should woo Hero for

speaker: BORACHIO
text: himself, and having obtained her, give her to Count

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Claudio.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: Come, come, let us thither. This may prove

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: food to my displeasure. That young start-up hath

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: all the glory of my overthrow. If I can cross him any

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: way, I bless myself every way. You are both sure, and

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: will assist me?

speaker: CONRADE
text: To the death, my lord.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: Let us to the great supper. Their cheer is the

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: greater that I am subdued. Would the cook were o’

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: my mind! Shall we go prove what’s to be done?

speaker: BORACHIO
text: We’ll wait upon your Lordship.
